snippet: Muhammad Shakil Auj, the dean of Islamic studies at the state-run University of Karachi, was vilified for a speech he gave in the United States in 2012.
abstract: Muhammad Shakil Auj, liberal Muslim scholar who was accused of blasphemy for speech he gave during a visit to the United States in 2012, is killed by unidentified gunmen in Karachi, Pakistan; accusations of blasphemy, crime punishable by death in Pakistan, have inspired a rising tide of vigilante killings that are seen as sign of growing intolerance in the country.
lead_paragraph: Muhammad Shakil Auj, the dean of Islamic studies at the state-run University of Karachi, was vilified for a speech he gave in the United States in 2012.

headline.main: A Pakistani Scholar Accused of Blasphemy Is Shot Dead
